Recipe #1
---------
Gather all following ingredients and follow the directions to prepare this tasty meal.

Ingredients:
  banana
  green apple
  red tuna

Directions:
  roast the banana
  slice the green apple
  dice the red tuna
  roast the red tuna
  prepare meal

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

Reason step-by-step about the feedback, the recipe, the items you are carrying and the room you are in and provide the next command. Use the format REASONING: <your reasoning here> NEXT COMMAND: <your next command here>

You are hungry! Let's cook a delicious meal. Check the cookbook in the kitchen for the recipe. Once done, enjoy your meal!

-= Kitchen =-
You've just shown up in a kitchen.

You see an opened fridge. The fridge contains a diced roasted red tuna and a raw red potato. There's something strange about this being here, but you can't put your finger on it. You can see a closed oven. You bend down to tie your shoe. When you stand up, you notice a table. The table is massive. On the table you make out a cookbook. You make out a counter. You see a roasted banana, a sliced green apple, a green bell pepper and a red apple on the counter. You can't wait to tell the folks at home about this! You can see a stove. But there isn't a thing on it. Oh! Why couldn't there just be stuff on it?

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

messages_raw.description:
-= Kitchen =-
I never took you for the sort of person who would show up in a kitchen, but I guess I was wrong.

You make out an open fridge. The fridge contains a red hot pepper, a raw yellow potato, a carrot and a raw chicken leg. You see an oven. You scan the room for a table, and you find a table. You shudder, but continue examining the table. The table is massive. On the table you can see a knife. You scan the room for a counter, and you find a counter. The counter is vast. On the counter you see a cookbook. You make out a stove. Wow, isn't TextWorld just the best? Unfortunately, there isn't a thing on it. Hm. Oh well

cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.

knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

look

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

Reason step-by-step about the feedback, the recipe, the items you are carrying and the room you are in and provide the next command. Use the format REASONING: <your reasoning here> NEXT COMMAND: <your next command here>

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

Reason step-by-step about the feedback, the recipe, the items you are carrying and the room you are in and provide the next command. Use the format REASONING: <your reasoning here> NEXT COMMAND: <your next command here>

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

Reason step-by-step about the feedback, the recipe, the items you are carrying and the room you are in and provide the next command. Use the format REASONING: <your reasoning here> NEXT COMMAND: <your next command here>

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

Reason step-by-step about the feedback, the recipe, the items you are carrying and the room you are in and provide the next command. Use the format REASONING: <your reasoning here> NEXT COMMAND: <your next command here>

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

Reason step-by-step about the feedback, the recipe, the items you are carrying and the room you are in and provide the next command. Use the format REASONING: <your reasoning here> NEXT COMMAND: <your next command here>

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

Reason step-by-step about the feedback, the recipe, the items you are carrying and the room you are in and provide the next command. Use the format REASONING: <your reasoning here> NEXT COMMAND: <your next command here>

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

Reason step-by-step about the feedback, the recipe, the items you are carrying and the room you are in and provide the next command. Use the format REASONING: <your reasoning here> NEXT COMMAND: <your next command here>

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife

<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

look

You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife

prepare meal
eat meal

Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.
